page.title: 18TELEVISION VIEWING
page.content: It is 1985, and we now have 4 television channels, BBC1, BBC2, CHANNEL (our local Channel Islands channel) and CHANNEL4. Most homes now have colour sets instead of black and white. The annual licence fee is Â£46 which is paid to the British Broadcasting Corporation. You are fined if it is not paid. We now have two channels which put out an early morning programme which has become very popular since it started two years ago. It covers news, sport, music, cookery, fashion etc. During the rest of the day typical programmes are news, weather, sport (for example football, cricket, horse-racing, snooker) and children's shows, such as Blue Peter and cartoons. There are also soap operas such as{Dynasty, Coronation Street and {Dallas.}
